description: From Middle English thornen, from Old English þyrnen (“thorny, of thorns”), from Proto-West Germanic *þurnīn, from Proto-Germanic *þurnīnaz (“of thorns”), equivalent to thorn +‎ -en.

adjectives.description: thornen (comparative more thornen, superlative most thornen)

entries.meaning: (dialectal or obsolete) Made of or consisting of thorns.
